item.title: How to count NULLs with SQL and R
item.description: When representing no values, NULL and NA are used in SQL and R, respectively. Be careful that NULL in R is not the same one as NULL in SQL. Using SQL select count(*) [Number of Null Salaries] from EmP where Salary is NULL Using base R # load the data into dataframe install.packages("RODBC") library(RODBC) conn <- odbcConnect("localhost") Emp <- sqlQuery(conn,"select * from capstone.dbo.Emp") numNAs <- apply(is.

item.title: How to randomly sample the data from a table
item.description: If your table is too large for effective processing, you may want to use a randomly selected subset of data from your original table. Example code: USE AdventureWorks2012 ; GO select count(*) from Person.Person SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Person.Person TABLESAMPLE (10 PERCENT); Data Source: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms189108(v=sql.105).aspx
